title: Mark Ruffalo smashed Boris Johnson’s Hulk-Brexit metaphor
text:
Comparing Brexit to the Hulk was an incredible mistake.

So says Mark Ruffalo, the actor who plays the green rage monster in the Disney-owned DIS, -1.61% Marvel Cinematic Universe.

British Prime Minister Boris Johnson told the Mail on Sunday that if Brexit negotiations break down, then the U.K. will break free of the European Union’s “manacles” like the Incredible Hulk. “The madder Hulk gets, the stronger Hulk gets,” he said.

“Banner might be bound in manacles, but when provoked he would explode out of them,” Johnson explained on Sunday. “Hulk always escaped, no matter how tightly bound in he seemed to be — and that is the case for this country. We will come out on Oct. 31 and we will get it done.”

But Ruffalo, 51, who has been embodying the Green One and his mild-mannered human alter ego Dr. Bruce Banner onscreen since the first “Avengers” movie in 2012, smashed that comparison to bits.

He tweeted on Sunday that the Hulk is much more powerful when working with his team — not running amok on his own.

‘Mad and strong can also be dense and destructive.’ Mark Ruffalo

“Boris Johnson forgets that the Hulk only fights for the good of a whole,” Ruffalo wrote on Twitter TWTR, +0.30% . “Mad and strong can also be dense and destructive. The Hulk works best when he is in unison with a team, and is a disaster when he is alone.”

He added, “Plus… he’s always got Dr. Banner with science and reason.”

Boris Johnson forgets that the Hulk only fights for the good of the whole. Mad and strong can also be dense and destructive. The Hulk works best when he is in unison with a team, and is a disaster when he is alone. Plus...he’s always got Dr. Banner with science and reason. pic.twitter.com/jN8BDzgpWl — Mark Ruffalo (@MarkRuffalo) September 15, 2019

Ruffalo wasn’t the only one to take a swing at Johnson’s comic book reference. Labour MP Jess Phillips tweeted that, “This is the kind of thing my kids would say aside from they would never make such glaring errors about The Hulk, I’ve raised them properly.”

Brexit coordinator and Belgian political Guy Verhofstadt called the Hulk comparison “infantile” even to “Trumpian standards.”

Even to Trumpian standards the Hulk comparison is infantile. Is the EU supposed to be scared by this? The British public impressed? Is this Boris Johnson whistling in the dark? https://t.co/g6FwEQCTMG — Guy Verhofstadt (@guyverhofstadt) September 15, 2019

The only similarity between Boris Johnson and the Incredible Hulk is that they both often wake up wondering where their trousers are. — Mr Roger Quimbly (@RogerQuimbly) September 15, 2019

Johnson was scheduled to have his first meeting with European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker in Luxembourg on Monday to seek out a longshot Brexit deal before next month’s deadline. He had to cancel a press conference following the talk, however, after being drowned out by booing protestors.
description: Johnson’s comic book comparison left plenty of people besides the “Avengers” star a little green.
